Example of recent E-mail Alert from GOA:

Nancy Pelosi and her anti-gun team are either profoundly stupid or genuinely evil.

Although either answer is arguably correct, the latter most likely explains H.R. 8 -- a bill that is scheduled for a hearing this week in the House Judiciary Committee.

With H.R. 8, Pelosi and her gun-hating cronies have crafted a ‚ÄúUniversal Background Check‚Äù bill with dozens of trap doors that could, if enforced to the letter, put millions of gun owners in prison.

Specifically, the bill outlaws the ‚Äútransfer‚Äù of a firearm without a Brady Check.¬†While this includes private sales, it by no means is limited to that.¬†

The term ‚Äútransfer‚Äù is nowhere defined, but it‚Äôs clear from the bill that handing your gun to a neighbor for as little as one second is a ‚Äútransfer‚Äù unless you‚Äôre covered by one of the bill‚Äôs so-called exceptions.

So if you show off your new gun to your neighbor in your living room, and hand it to him to look at, you‚Äôre a criminal, and can go to prison for up to a year under federal level.

But as onerous as this provision is, the worst part consists of the Universal Gun Registry the bill would create.

Under H.R. 8, since every gun transfer will go through a dealer, every gun owner will have a 4473.¬†

We know that the ATF, in connection with annual inspections conducted under federal law, is increasingly copying these forms to its database in a centrally accessible format.¬†See examples here.

So here‚Äôs the problem: if everyone has a 4473, everyone is potentially in the database.

Even the Obama Administration recognized this in 2013, when a leaked memo from the Justice Department revealed its assessment of Universal Background Checks:
Effectiveness depends on the ability to reduce straw purchasing, requiring gun registration .... (Emphasis added.)

Regardless, gun grabbers today are trying to put a new spin on Universal Registration Checks. They claim that section 5(1) in the bill prohibits registration.

The problem is that the Firearm Owners Protection Act of 1986 CURRENTLY prohibits a national gun registry.¬†And yet, the ATF is not interpreting that prohibition from preventing it from doing what it‚Äôs already doing.¬†

So if the current prohibition isn‚Äôt effective, why would anyone suppose that putting it in the law a second time would make any difference?¬†

Are we putting the ATF on double super-secret probation?

As I mentioned above, the House is now pushing this bill to the forefront.

So please send your Representative¬†a pre-written letter OPPOSING H.R. 8.

If you call your Representative -- and want additional talking points -- you can go here to see GOA‚Äôs Fact Sheet on H.R. 8.

Thank you.

In Liberty,

Erich Pratt
 Executive Director

This is pretty much George Lincoln Rockwells most famous speech, its "Nazism, The Only Answer To Communism".

American National Socialism under George Lincoln Rockwell and his American Nazi Party (previously known as World Union of Free Enterprise National Socialists - WUFENS) was very different from German National Socialism according to the NSDAP. In most ways we will never know, because he never attained power and it never took a physical form beyond the ideological training his men faced, his internal power structure which Im not actually an expert on, and his simplified definition of what National Socialism is.

One glaring difference is that most of us will say we are "National Socialists" - where as Rockwell actually made an effort to put "Nazi" in the party. He is fairly unique in this regard and his motivation can be summed up as doing it to provoke the media into giving him coverage so he could spread his message, even if distorted. He had pointed out that when he put a business suit on, spoke calmly and held a press release, no one showed up to hear what he had to say.. but when he put a Swastika armband on and called himself a Nazi, thats when people would see his words printed in the papers.

Rockwell had a multi-stage plan where he would slowly reduce the aggressiveness of his rhetoric and become a much more calm and reasoned person. At first he would agitate the bottom tier, the people who were simply angry and disenfranchised with raw emotion.(boat ticket to Africa) Then he would focus on the middle, the average working man whos simply fed up with the whole thing, the guy who likes to read books and about the news, but isnt exactly interested in long scientific tracts and intellectual arguments. That took the form of his "Rockwell Report" Finally, when he had broad support among those two groups - he would focus on making inarguable intellectual positions to the elite whites who held a lot of financial power at the time. Once all three strata of society were on board, the Jews were through. He was pretty far along in his plan, he had released National Socialist World with William Luther Pierce collaborating - and that was his Cherries Jubilee(always hits me in the feels). He was a powerful orator who would enter a hostile crowd and have them in the palm of his hand, shouting down his hecklers by the end, literally begging him not to go. If not for his assassination officially by a man who had been expelled for having bolshevik leanings, he very well could have been the American F√ºhrer. Thanks nazbols.
